page.title: 05FARMING IN BURNHAM MARKET 4
page.content: It is necessary for some of the farms to use{mechanical irrigation}, notably Gallow Hill Farm, Westgate and Chalk Farm. Sussex Farm has a water bore. There are wells on Gallow Hill Farm, Sussex Farm, Chalk Farm and Cradle Hall Farm. Sunnymead Farm and Sussex Farm have natural springs. Modern barns are now taking over from the traditional{Norfolk barns}; these still remain though none has a preservation order on it. Sussex Farm has 23 farmworkers' cottages, though these are not all used for farmworkers. Muckleton has four and Crabbe Hall has one. There are{shooting rights}on all the farms and these are all used, except at Crabbe Hall. Pheasants and partridges are reared for shooting at Sussex Farm and at Friar's Thorne Farm.
